N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 12 §§ 349-2.8 - Conduct of hearing

State Regulations

The arbitration committee shall not be bound by common
law or statutory rules of evidence or by technical or formal rules of
procedure, but may make such investigation or inquiry and conduct its hearing
in such a manner as it deems proper and necessary in the premises. The
arbitration committee may, in the event of nonappearance, decide the value of
the disputed bill on the basis of the evidence before it. The majority decision
of such a committee shall be conclusive upon the parties as to the value of the
services rendered. Notes
